concept.title: Include the Application ID in Requests
concept.shortdesc: Configure the HTTP clients to include the HTTP Server application ID in each request.

conbody.p: When you configure the HTTP Server origin, you define an application ID that is used to pass requests to the origin. All messages sent to the origin must include the application ID.same as the Prerequisites for WebSocket Server origin, make updates in both places
Include the application ID for each client request in one of the following ways:

dlentry.dd: Add the following information to the request header for all HTTP POST requests that you want the origin to process:X-SDC-APPLICATION-ID: <application_ID>

dlentry.dt: In a query parameter in the URL
dlentry.dd: If you cannot configure the client request headers - for example if the requests are generated by another system - then configure each HTTP client to send data to a URL that includes the application ID in a query parameter.

To include the application ID in a query parameter, enable the Allow Application ID through Query Param property when you configure the origin. Then, include the application ID in a URL query parameter.
Use the following format for the URL:<http | https>://<sdc_hostname>:<listening_port>/?sdcApplicationId=<application_ID>

The URL includes the following components:
<http | https> - Use https for secure HTTP connections.
<sdc_hostname> - The host name.
<listening_port> - The port number where the origin listens for data.
<application_ID> - The application ID defined for the HTTP Server origin.
